title: Enhanced hydrogen storage property of MgH2 caused by a BaCrO4 nanocatalyst
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,23930-23942
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA03460K, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Chenxi Liang, Zhenbin Wang, Mingjin Zhang, Cunhua Ma
Magnesium hydroxide (MgH2) has a broad application prospect in solid hydrogen storage, but the associated higher dehydrogenation temperature and undesirable cycling capacity limit its large-scale application.
